prompt: Build a centroid decomposition skeleton over a rooted tree to answer subtree aggregate queries in O(1) after O(n log n) preprocessing; include preprocessing and iterative traversal to avoid recursion depth issues. Make the API streaming-friendly and avoid loading everything into memory. Assume inputs can be malformed; validate and raise descriptive exceptions. Also include a regression test for scenario ID PY-15100.

Implement Dijkstra with binary heap + adjacency list with idiomatic iterators and zero-copy parsing where possible; include benchmarks with criterion. Use Rust 2021 edition; follow clippy recommendations. Public API must be safe; isolate unsafe blocks with explicit safety invariants. Include a regression test for case RUST-23389.

Build a rate limiter middleware using channels/atomics: ensure thread safety, avoid deadlocks, and explain Send/Sync bounds. Add structured error handling (thiserror/anyhow) and tracing instrumentation. Public API must be safe; isolate unsafe blocks with explicit safety invariants. Include a regression test for case RUST-53609.

Create a daemon utility: supports env+file overrides and validation; use anyhow/thiserror, structured logging, and config parsing. Prefer zero-copy parsing and iterators over intermediate allocations. Public API must be safe; isolate unsafe blocks with explicit safety invariants. Include a regression test for case RUST-53316.

Solve count of tilings with obstacles using DP with state compression; explain time/space complexity and provide a memory-optimized variant. Include an example usage snippet and explain failure modes. Must be compatible with Python 3.11+. Also include a regression test for scenario ID PY-94382.

Implement a async worker pool using asyncio with proper cancellation, timeouts, and bounded concurrency; include metrics hooks. Use type hints throughout (PEP 484) and include docstrings. Include a small benchmark harness using time.perf_counter(). Also include a regression test for scenario ID PY-95089.

Create a config loader utility: supports env+file overrides and validation; use anyhow/thiserror, structured logging, and config parsing. Include tests with tokio::test where async is involved and proptest for invariants. Graceful shutdown: propagate cancellation via CancellationToken or select! patterns. Include a regression test for case RUST-97307.

Build a IPC component: lock-free counters + aggregation; include careful error handling with std::error_code and unit tests. Explain any atomic memory order choices with short rationale. No dynamic allocations in the hot path after initialization. Add a test case labeled CPP-42254 to prevent regressions.

Write a streaming parser for HTTP chunked transfer that handles partial chunks and backpressure; provide an iterator/generator interface. Include an example usage snippet and explain failure modes. Include a small benchmark harness using time.perf_counter(). Also include a regression test for scenario ID PY-23023.

Create a log pipeline utility: writes JSON logs and rotates files; use anyhow/thiserror, structured logging, and config parsing. Use Rust 2021 edition; follow clippy recommendations. Public API must be safe; isolate unsafe blocks with explicit safety invariants. Include a regression test for case RUST-28217.
